children.subject: I am posting in the discussion because I am not 100% sure about this, but in my understanding, lower divs that count towards the major if you are EECS or CS, have to be taken at Berkeley. Even if they are not I really doubt that EE16A has a possible substitute that you can take somewhere else and have it count without labs. If a possible substitute exists it will definitely have labs, which you (probably) won't have the time to do because you'll be interning. Just take it next semester. EE16A is a lot of fun and might even encourage you to try a bit more on the EECS side. If you have taken 54 2/3 of the course will be easy and then circuits is just practice
Do it online at a California community college! That's what I did with both my international studies breadth and R1B.
Is there a California community college that offers particularly good online courses?
Also anyone have experience doing R1B or an LS breadth outside of CA? East coast native here, it'd be nice to be home for the summer instead of fulfilling the same requirements in Berkeley.

history.content: I think there's kind of a grey area here, but I think in short, you'd have to get the course that you take evaluated by the transfer specialist at Berkeley. So you'd be banking on that person accepting the transfer credit. I tried to get a few courses transferred from home (from Georgia) for both CS and Math. The math department didn't transfer exactly perfectly and I ended up getting like 3 out of 4 units for math 54 (what does that even mean? The professor basically just told me I get 3/4ths credit for the class, so I still need to take it). The CS department is a bit nicer and formalized and has an online form to fill out. So in my experience, I think it's pretty difficult to get out of state credits to transfer unless the course is almost identical (via syllabus) to the one you want to get credit for at Berkeley
Hard to answer without more information. Major requirements, or general ed? Lower or upper div?

I'll be interning in NYC this summer. I was wondering if it's possible to take summer classes at a university/community college outside of CA and have it count? I had used ASSIST a couple years ago to take a class one summer at DVC in Pleasant Hill, but is there any service to see classes in other states? I'm specifically looking to see if I can take EE16A. Thanks.
history.subject: Summer Classes outside of CA?
